Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Object
Abstract class representing a generic game level in the application. It manages game entities, user input, collision detection, and game state transitions.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, Controller controller)
      Constructs a new LevelParent instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - The path to the background image for the level.
      screenHeight - The height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen.
      controller - The controller managing the game state.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units for the level. Must be implemented by subclasses to add specific friendly entities.

    • getObjectiveText

      protected abstract String getObjectiveText()
      Retrieves the objective text for the level.
      Returns:
      The objective text.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks the game state to determine if the game is over. Must be implemented by subclasses to define specific game over conditions.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units within the level. Must be implemented by subclasses to define specific enemy spawning logic.

    • NewHeartDisplay

      protected HeartDisplay NewHeartDisplay(javafx.scene.Group root, double xPosition, double yPosition, int heartsToDisplay)
      Creates a new HeartDisplay instance.
      Parameters:
      root - The root group to which the HeartDisplay will be added.
      xPosition - The X position of the HeartDisplay.
      yPosition - The Y position of the HeartDisplay.
      heartsToDisplay - The initial number of hearts to display.
      Returns:
      A new HeartDisplay instance.

      Returns:
      The initialized Scene object.

      private void updateScene()
      Updates the game scene by processing input, spawning enemies, updating actors, handling collisions, and checking game over conditions.

      private void updateActors(double deltaTime)
      Updates all actors (friendly units, enemy units, projectiles, shields, power-ups) based on deltaTime.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time elapsed since the last update in seconds.

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      private void removeAllDestroyedActors()
      Removes all destroyed actors from their respective lists and the scene graph.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      @SafeVarargs private void removeDestroyedActors(List<Actor> actors, ObjectPool<Projectile>... pools)
      Removes destroyed actors from the provided list and releases projectiles back to their pools.
      Parameters:
      actors - The list of actors to check and remove.
      pools - Optional object pools to release projectiles back to.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      private void removeDestroyedActors(List<Actor> actors)
      Removes destroyed actors from the provided list without interacting with object pools.
      Parameters:
      actors - The list of actors to check and remove.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions()
      Handles collisions between various actors such as projectiles, shields, and power-ups.

    • handlePickupCollisions

      private void handlePickupCollisions(List<Actor> actors1, List<Actor> powerUps)
      Handles collisions between actors1 and power-ups, triggering pickup actions.
      Parameters:
      actors1 - The first list of actors involved in collisions.
      powerUps - The list of power-up actors involved in collisions.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<Actor> actors1, List<Actor> actors2)
      Handles collisions between actors1 and actors2, applying damage as necessary.
      Parameters:
      actors1 - The first list of actors involved in collisions.
      actors2 - The second list of actors involved in collisions.

    • handleEnemyPenetration

      private void handleEnemyPenetration()
      Handles scenarios where enemies penetrate past the screen boundaries, resulting in damage to the user.

    • updateKillCount

      protected void updateKillCount()
      Updates the kill count based on the number of enemies eliminated.

      Loses the game by displaying the game over image, stopping animations, and handling cleanup.

      Retrieves the controller managing the game.
      Returns:

    • cleanUp

      public void cleanUp()
      Cleans up resources by stopping timelines, clearing lists, and removing nodes from the scene graph. It also nullifies references to aid garbage collection.

    • getUser

      public UserPlane getUser()
      Retrieves the user's plane.
      Returns:
      The UserPlane instance.

    • getRoot

      Retrieves the root group of the scene graph.
      Returns:
      The root Group.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      Gets the current number of enemies (including shields) in the level.
      Returns:
      The total number of enemies.

    • updateNumberOfEnemies

      private void updateNumberOfEnemies()
      Updates the count of current enemies based on the size of enemy and shield lists.

    • removeOutOfBounds

      private void removeOutOfBounds(List<Actor> projectiles, double width, double height)
      Removes projectiles that have moved out of the game boundaries.
      Parameters:
      projectiles - The list of projectiles to check.
      width - The width boundary of the game screen.
      height - The height boundary of the game screen.

    • removeProjectilesOutOfBounds

      private void removeProjectilesOutOfBounds()
      Removes projectiles that are out of bounds from both user and enemy projectile lists.

    • addProjectile

      public void addProjectile(Projectile projectile, Actor owner)
      Adds a projectile to the appropriate projectile list based on the owner.
      Parameters:
      projectile - The Projectile to be added.
      owner - The Actor who owns the projectile.

    • getUserProjectilePool

      public ObjectPool<Projectile> getUserProjectilePool()
      Retrieves the object pool for user projectiles.
      Returns:
      The ObjectPool managing user projectiles.

    • getEnemyProjectilePool

      public ObjectPool<Projectile> getEnemyProjectilePool()
      Retrieves the object pool for enemy projectiles.
      Returns:
      The ObjectPool managing enemy projectiles.

    • getBossProjectilePool

      public ObjectPool<Projectile> getBossProjectilePool()
      Retrieves the object pool for boss projectiles.
      Returns:
      The ObjectPool managing boss projectiles.

    • getBossTwoProjectilePool

      public ObjectPool<Projectile> getBossTwoProjectilePool()
      Retrieves the object pool for boss two projectiles.
      Returns:
      The ObjectPool managing boss two projectiles.
